name: Lowry Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have travelled extensively in England, but had never been to Manchester, so we took a quick detour this trip. And we were so pleasantly surprised by all it has to offer. Having a great hotel like the Lowry is also a bonus. The location of the hotel is top-notch, and we found that the online instructions got us there with ease, despite someone else's comment that it was hard to find. I also LOVED the parking lot right across the driveway. We could see our car from our city-view room, and felt comfortable leaving some items in the car, since the security seemed so good.
reviews.title: Take a detour to Manchester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable. It was spacious with good sheets and REN toiletries in the bath. The large walk-in closet was nice as well. I enjoyed the book left in the room about the artist, L.S. Lowry, after whom the hotel is named. My sons' room had another title about the artist, so this gave a personal touch to the hotel. I did think that the hotel hallways had a bit of a blank look, but they were spacious. And my only real complaint is that the housekeeping staff did not seem to be at all friendly. Instead of being greeted in hall, the housekeeper averted her eyes when I passed, which surprised me in a hotel of this caliber. Oh, also didn't like that the windows don't open.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast room was attractive, but my breakfast of waffles was not great. Honestly, the waffle tasted rewarmed, or else it had been sitting out quite a while before it was served. It didn't taste fresh. The restaurant manager was very friendly, though, and the view is great. My son seemed to enjoy the breakfast buffet, although to me, although it looked good on the surface, I wasn't sure I could find anything to eat. The English breakfast was not fresh-cooked, but was from the buffet.
reviews.title: Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: We loved the location, being just a little bit removed from the center of town by the attractive bridge right by the Lowry. We only stayed a day, but there was lots to explore in Manchester, and I'm sure we could have spent another day or two in town with no problem. All in all, a very nice place.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: I visit Manchester sometimes and stay in the Lowry, the hotel is really nice and the staff are superb. The rooms are magnificent and very modern. I love the bed's in the Lowry better than most hotels i have stayed in. The hotel is bit like a football club as it seems everyone there is a football player there most times i stay even though i dont really watch football. Food is great in fact i cant really find fault with the Lowry apart from the building site it is on at the moment.
reviews.title: 5* heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night on a Bed and Breakfast rate. Great room, good service and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was very busy but still found everyone really helpful and didn't wait too long for service in the bar. The terrace is great place for lunch when the weather is good.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice hotel fantastic bedrooms very large. The staff across the board were very good. Not too keen on the bar but just a personal thing but seemed to lack the atmosphere I enjoy in a bar. As you would expect from a hotel like this very expensive for drinks. A great location to get to wherever you need to be in Manchester city centre.
reviews.title: All's well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Stayed over a Sunday night. Nt the easiest place to find with a vehicle but once there all's well. Convenient car park. Reception staff (and all others) very friendly and helpful. Room (standard grade) extremely large and well presented - all in all a very good, if a bit pricey, stay and good location for exploring Manchester. Recommended.
reviews.title: The hotel with spacious rooms and very good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed on a business trip in July 2012. The check in went smooth with a very friendly staff. Good information about rooms, facilities and services. And when entering into room 202 (or was it 203) the room felt really spacious and clean with a big and nice bathroom. The only negative part was that you had to pay for the Internet, but the access code was valid for three machines. Good beds and very quiet, I slept like a stone. Breakfast was excellent with a a la carte menu and with fresh orange juice constantly refilled in the glass by a friendly staff. The friendly staff in the door wishing you welcome was also there when leaving the hotel. I parked on the parking just outside the hotel. The hotel was in walking distance to the city center and next to a canal. The dinner in the restaurant was also very good with a very attentive staff. If staying in spacious rooms in a hotel close to the city center I would definately recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I dont know why I bother looking at other hotels when I stay in Manchester.
reviews.title: No place better to stay in Manchester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes it is a bit more expensive ..so if you are working to a strict budget you are going to get better value elsewhere ...you do not get the discounts here that other hotels offer...
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saying that...you are not going to get anything like an enjoyable stay ....
reviews.title: The best hotel in Manchester, truly 5 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Location is Central...so perfect for business and pleasure..
reviews.title: The Hotel that keeps on giving...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are efficient , professional and helpful....
reviews.title: No doubt we will return in the future

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night here, having stayed a few times before. It is pricey, but we feel it is worth it as it is so classy and luxurious. We had a noise issue this week and after we calmly explained the problem, Peter Kienast was extremely helpful in finding a quick and helpful resolution. We will stay there each time we go to this great city. Peter offered us a room to chill before we set off down the motorway, but this was more than we needed. He will know who we are, so thanks again Peter and our kindest regards to you and your staff. I must stress that noise is not a problem I would associate with this hotel at all. If you can afford it, this hotel needs to be visited, absolutely.
reviews.title: Helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Lowry Hotel for my birthday last month.
reviews.title: Bar/Restaurant amazing, rooms a bit disappointing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff on arrival were so happy to help and immediately took our bags off us. We had arrived early and were checked in straight away by Ewan which was lovely. We went off around manchester and then made our way back to the hotel - once in my room i noticed some rather strange greasy handprints on the walls of our room, as well as other greasy marks on the walls which looked as though someone had been pressed against it (if you catch my drift) My partner complained as he had proposed that day and didnt want the marks to taint our day. At this point I had already opened my bottle of champagne and noticed one of the two flutes provided had a crack in the lip of the glass.
reviews.title: A few niggles but would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were then moved to a lower floor so moved all the luggage and things ourselves. I went to get a fresh flute from the mini bar, only to realise once I had nipped my lip that this glass too was damaged.
reviews.title: A* Experience. Once you have tried you will never stay anywhere else....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: The wifi worked for mobile phones, but not the games console we had with us.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, excellent staff, but pay for Wi-Fi?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was nice and easy, and we booked breakfast for the following morning there and then. Upon arrival in the room, it was nice and big with a walk in wardrobe area, flat screen TV and ipod docking system.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel & staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few niggles - the ipod docker didn't work due to a loose connection, but great music is available through the TV, so this was no big deal. The lighting in the room is not great. It is very spread out around the edges of the room, so hair & make up has to be done standing at the walk in wardobe area or the bathroom. The bed was 2 single beds pushed together which was a little annoying.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea at the Lowry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally the hotel is tucked a little further away from town, but this is kind of nice as it is a lot quieter than some of the other Manchester hotels we have stayed in. The concierge were very helpful in calling us taxis and helping out with umbrellas in the Mancunian summer weather!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall this hotel is very clean, nice and quiet and with great staff service. Breakfast was wonderful and arrived very promptly. I would imagine we shall be returning soon! Thanks Lowry!
reviews.title: Very very nice- as it should be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went for a champagne afternoon tea (a present) Nice surroundings, friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful staff who were keen to make our visit memorable. Unfortunately we had been to the Ritz for afternoon tea a couple of years ago and the Lowry is not as good. You can't expect the surroundings to be on the same level as the Ritz as this is a new hotel but that aside they didn't have much of a selection of teas (no orange pekoe) and they didn't come round with seconds of sandwiches as they did at the Ritz. The selection of cakes wasn't great but what there were were very nice and the scones were excellent. The champagne was very good (Billycart Salmon NV), with strawberries; excellent. After tea we sat on the terrace overlooking the river and watched a gay wedding. A good end to the day. Despite my criticisms I would happily go again
reviews.title: Lovely staff

description: Manchester's most fashionable hotel, the award-winning Lowry Hotel is ideally situated on the banks of the River Irwell in the recently-developed Chapel Wharf area on the Salford-Manchester boundary. The first five-star hotel in Greater Manchester, The Lowry Hotel makes a bold contemporary architectural statement with its dramatic, curved, glass-fronted façade that creates a light and airy feel within the hotel interior.
